page.title: 15My school Hill Ridware.
page.content: Our school was built 1914 Its name is Henry Chadwick.I walk to school.Some come by car and others arrive by school bus.At nine a bell rings for assembly. We have two hymns ,a story ,school news and a prayer.There is a weekly radio broadcast.Mornings are maths and english finishing at 12.15pm.Afternoons are 1.30pm to 3.45pm covering environmental studies ,music,art and craft,games and swimming.Childrens ages are five to eleven years.Our uniforms consists of grey shirt,white shirt,grey or green jumper,gold and green tie.The school is situated in a rural area with a large school field.We have a computer.There are four classes with 95 children and five staff.Most children stay school lunch.It is a happy school with no corporal punishment.
